user: My dad passed away recently from a workplace accident, am I eligible for any scholarships?
bot: I'm so sorry for your loss. If you were studying at the time of your father's passing, the Shrama Vasana Fund offers financial aid, a scholarship worth Rs. 50,000, and an educational kit worth Rs. 10,000.  Please contact them directly to confirm your eligibility and for the most recent application details.

user: What documents do I need to prepare for the application?
bot: My sincere condolences on your loss.  For the Shrama Vasana Fund scholarship, you'll need your father's National Identity Card (or passport/driver's license), birth certificate, death certificate, proof of residence (DS4 form), and a letter from his employer confirming his employment and the accidental death. For your part, you'll need your own identification, birth certificate, proof of current student status, and documentation showing your relationship to your father. If you have a guardian, their information will be required as well.  All documents should be certified by the Grama Niladari and Divisional Secretary.  It's always best to contact the Shrama Vasana Fund directly for the most up-to-date requirements.
